revised_title: The Effect of Temperature on Plant Incompatibility
tldr: This article explores the effect of temperature on plant incompatibility and pollen tube growth in various plant species. The study found that compatible pollinations showed increased growth rates with increased temperature, while incompatible pollinations had an optimum growth rate between 15-20°C. The results suggest that temperature differences can affect self-incompatibility in plants, and the mechanisms behind this are related to immunity reactions.
